title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to Chris Anderson's [[Federated Wiki]] site. Fed Wiki is a new style of wiki where everyone can have their own wiki, but still share pages. I'm hoping you feel like "forking" my pages to your site and vice versa. To get your own site, just change the beginning of the URL (where I have jchris) to something that's not already taken.

title: start your own wiki.
synopsis: To create a site, just visit federatedwiki.org with your subdomain in front and get started. Eg if you want eggs.federatedwiki.org just visit that URL to claim it.

title: Portland Green Streets
synopsis: Portland has numerous policies to encourage community uses of street space. The Portland Department of Transportation is not only excited to have folks bring them proposals, they are excited for our help raising awareness about these options.

title: Neighborhood
synopsis: The wiki keeps track of sites you visit and sites mentioned on pages you visit on each site. Wiki seeks to know about sites in this collection called a neighborhood.

title: User Directory
synopsis: Add yourself here if you have a federated wiki. Then fork this page to easily access the full neighborhood.

title: Advanced work
synopsis: Esko Kilpi questions the cultural metaphors that guide our actions at work and in society as belonging to an outmoded industrial era. Creative, knowledge-based work crosses traditional organisational boundaries: organisations are emergent self-organising processes. [https://medium.com/@EskoKilpi/advanced-work-5ac3d810fe49 essay].

title: Rebooting ODOT
synopsis: There is an attitude problem at the Oregon Department of Transportation that can't be fixed with policy changes. [http://bikeportland.org/2015/08/05/man-adds-warning-paint-sunken-grate-state-roads-agency-calls-vandalism-154842 ODOT knows and doesn't care.]

title: Letter to ODOT
synopsis:
Matthew Garrett and Rian Windsheimer,

As far as I can tell you are the names we should associate with the insulting and injurious line of thinking your agency is wallowing in. If there is someone else, please point me in their direction.

Read these comments and think about me thinking about how to put your name in lights. And nothing you do on those particular grates is gonna save you.


Jim Otterson August 5, 2015 at 9:47 pm
ODOT: Put some hot melt loop sealant in the longitudinal crack – takes 10 minutes, MAX, problem solved. Raise the drain inlet grate on the other location, and add a grate with transverse bars, then add asphalt to raise the surrounding grade: Time to complete – one evening shift. Dollars spent, not much. Dollars saved from lawsuit by injured cyclist/dead cyclist: Incalculable, but definitely NOT cheap. I’m a civil engineer with 34 years experience in the highway and traffic industry, this is easy guys. Get with the program.





ac August 5, 2015 at 3:54 pm
There were crews there most of last winter dealing with the bridge guard rail extensions.

They had traffic control there for MONTHS — the grates could have been simply dealt with then, no?



Bike Manufacturer August 5, 2015 at 2:20 pm
We have been complaining about the grates, grooved gutter, and narrow lane since before 2000, with ZERO positive response. The street has been completely re-paved and stripped at least twice since we started complaining with no improvements to the road for cyclists. We now use the side street route pioneered by Portland skateboarders in the 60’s as an alternative. Taylor’s Ferry Rd./2nd/Ruby Tr. or 5th/5th/ Terwilliger. Ruby Terrace is very rough for bikes.
